attributes.comment:
A 60% hike in fees to immigrate legally will be cost prohibitive for many who are
trying to "do right" by going through a ridiculous process that makes no promises
and does not adequately perform. My fear is that, if approved, this will deter more
people from trying to immigrate legally. More people will "sneak" across borders
(whether on their own, or brought here by U.S. citizen employers) because they
won't be able to afford the process. In turn, this will breed more xenophobia (like
some displayed on this comment board) and fewer solutions to what is clearly a
problem. What will happen with the helpless who have no where else to turn--will
we just turn them away?

Only the truly fortunate (i.e. those of us who are already here) have the luxury of
criticizing the poor for wanting to make a better world (i.e. by immigrating to our
wonderful country) for themselves and their families. I am glad that there are so
many fortunate people here in this country, but I am ashamed at how they turn
their backs on those who need us most. I would encourage them to actually learn
about the immigration process, rather than comment out of ignorance. Please,
realize that just because someone new comes to this country doesn't mean that
they're a bad person who only steals and lives on welfare. Remember, the
majority of us here are here because our ancestors were once immigrants.
attributes.title: Comment Submitted By Anonymous
